data.title: Insiders doesn't update on first shutdown after running overnight.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.3.0-insiders
- OS Version:Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Come in to work and go to an open Insiders instance (it's been running all night).
2. See banner saying "Insiders will be updated after it restarts."
3. Click "Update Now"

Insiders instance closes but nothing happens. No installation prompt.
If I look in Windows Task Manager, I can see a running Code - Insiders.exe.
If I minimize all open windows, I don't see an installation prompt hidden anywhere.

This has been happening often but not sure when it started.

If I restart code-insiders.exe, next time I get the "Insiders will be updated after it restarts" and click "Update Now", I do get the installation prompt and it succeeds.

data.title: Layer breakers from code/electron-main to vs/workbench
data.body:
Some issues:
- there are dependencies into `vs/workbench` from `vs/code`
- `vs/code/main` has knowledge about git for the askpass and reaches into `vs/workbench/part/git` (this probably asks for some kind of registry to contribute)

data.title: Tab key deletes selection if line wraps over two lines
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.3.0-insider (a1293f5056e79c3f0e2cd3e24909f41ff4eef472, 2016-07-05T13:09:46.271Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14379

Steps to Reproduce:
1. write a long line so that text wraps onto the next line (text should wrap on a single line, the problem doesn't seem to appear otherwise)
2. select the whole line by going to the begining of the line, press shift + end, then keep shift down, and press the arrow key to select the part that wraps onto the next line
3. press `tab`: the text is removed instead of beeing shifted to the right

![vscodetabproblem](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/199648/16618967/54f31a5e-438c-11e6-9c20-b32d29b1e342.gif)

data.title: Duplicate, ever-increasing, non-resetting error count
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1 (fe7f407b)
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise (10586.420)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open folder with many dotnet core projects
2. Invoke gulp-based build command as below

tasks.json:

```
        {
            "taskName": "build",
            "args": [ "build" ],
            "isBuildCommand": true,
            "showOutput": "silent",
            "problemMatcher": "$msCompile"
        },
```

gulpfile.js (relevant bit):

```
gulp.task('build', 
    shell.task([
        'dotnet build **/project.json'
    ])
);
```
1. See correct build output as below (if output window open)

```
[12:57:41] Using gulpfile c:\git\kierenj\saffron-0.2\gulpfile.js
[12:57:41] Starting 'build'...
Project app (.NETCoreApp,Version=v1.0) was previously compiled. Skipping compilation.
Project Xyz.Something1 (.NETStandard,Version=v1.6) was previously compiled. Skipping compilation.
Project Xyz.Something2 (.NETStandard,Version=v1.6) will be compiled because inputs were modified
Compiling Xyz.Something2 for .NETStandard,Version=v1.6
C:\Program Files\dotnet\dotnet.exe compile-csc @c:\git\kierenj\xyz-0.2\src\Xyz.Something2\obj\Debug\netstandard1.6\dotnet-compile.rsp returned Exit Code 1
Compilation failed.
    0 Warning(s)
    1 Error(s)
Time elapsed 00:00:01.1862173
c:\git\kierenj\saffron-0.2\src\Xyz.Something2\AppBuilderExtensions.cs(7,35): error CS0161: 'AppBuilderExtensions.UseAutofac(IAppBuilder)': not all code paths return a value
Project Xyz.Something3 (.NETCoreApp,Version=v1.0) was previously compiled. Skipping compilation.
[12:57:42] 'build' errored after 1.93 s
[12:57:42] Error: Command `dotnet build **/project.json` failed with exit code 1
    at ChildProcess.exithandler (child_process.js:213:12)
    at emitTwo (events.js:87:13)
    at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:172:7)
    at maybeClose (internal/child_process.js:827:16)
    at Socket.<anonymous> (internal/child_process.js:319:11)
    at emitOne (events.js:77:13)
    at Socket.emit (events.js:169:7)
    at Pipe._onclose (net.js:477:12)
:
```
1. Immediately notice 3 errors in the bottom bar, not 1.  Once I had 4 errors, no changes!
2. Change a line, rebuild the app
3. Number immediately decreases to 2 (or sometimes 1), before coming back up to 3 upon build completion

I got up to a point of having 99 errors in the status bar, with only one build error, which was not flagged.  I don't know the exact steps for _that_, that was after a 1-hour session.

If I can provide more diag info, let me know.

data.title: Make it possible to use DND and Ctrl+A within a HTML preview (<webview>)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider
- OS Version: windows7

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Download My extension:  https://github.com/f111fei/test-files/raw/master/webview-test-0.0.1.vsix
2.  Run command `Hello Webview` to open my webview.

Problem:
1.  Drag Button into TextArea. Dragfeedback overlay will prevent  my dragging action.
2.  Typing some text in the textarea. Use `Ctrl+A` to select all, Nothing happen.

Reason
1. see https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/window.ts#L91, the default drag handler is prevented.
2. see https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/platform/keybinding/browser/keybindingServiceImpl.ts#L380, `selectAll` handler is prevented.

![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7069719/16614676/14cd3018-43a5-11e6-9d5b-0335069faf9e.png)

data.title: Path must be a string. Received null
data.body:
Note that with the Electron update some `fs` and `path` methods do stricter checks. I think before you could pass in null to `path.extname` without an error. Now I get this:

```
[20895:0706/113131:INFO:CONSOLE(248)] "Path must be a string. Received null: TypeError: Path must be a string. Received null
    at assertPath (path.js:7:11)
    at Object.extname (path.js:1429:5)
    at LanguageProvider.handles (/home/ticino/development/monaco/extensions/typescript/out/typescriptMain.js:188:30)
    at TypeScriptServiceClientHost.findLanguage (/home/ticino/development/monaco/extensions/typescript/out/typescriptMain.js:283:26)
    at TypeScriptServiceClientHost.handles (/home/ticino/development/monaco/extensions/typescript/out/typescriptMain.js:278:23)
    at Timeout._onTimeout (/home/ticino/development/monaco/extensions/typescript/out/typescriptMain.js:60:181)
    at tryOnTimeout (timers.js:224:11)
    at Timer.listOnTimeout (timers.js:198:5)", source: file:////home/ticino/development/monaco/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/shell.js (248)

```

data.title: Errors/warnings only shown for open files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a typescript project with a tsconfig
2. Open a file with no errors, see there are no errors in the project
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2505474/16612218/1bdf8c82-4366-11e6-9aad-2caa23a9f5af.png)
3. Open a file with errors, and the errors start popping up
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2505474/16612245/37ff3a98-4366-11e6-98b7-f82939f31ed7.png)

My tsconfig:

``` json
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "module": "commonjs",
    "noImplicitAny": false,
    "removeComments": true,
    "preserveConstEnums": true,
    "outDir": "dist/",
    "rootDir": "src/",
    "allowJs": true,
    "sourceMap": true,
    "listFiles": true,
    "target": "es6",
    "jsx": "react",
    "moduleResolution": "node"
  },
  "exclude": [
    "node_modules",
    "dist",
    ".vscode",
    "test"
  ]
}
```

data.title: [razor] Property indexer mess up code highlighting

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  1.2.1
- OS Version:
  OSX El Capitan

When using indexers to access properties, the syntax highlighting stops working for the rest of the document. I use @inject IViewLocalizer Localizer and then in the code @Localizer["SomeKey"]. This causes the styling to be wrong. It seems to work better with @Localizer.SomeMethod("SomeKey")

Have a look at the attributes on the form tag below.

![skarmavbild 2016-07-06 kl 10 40 35](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/860380/16612223/21626602-4366-11e6-9968-a20917f955e8.png)

2. Go To Symbol - the type does not appear

data.title: Weird tabs auto scrolling behaviour?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0 Insider
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:
1. I have opened multiple tabs in one single group editor
2. Scroll to the last tab in this group
3. Move the cursor into the editor part
4. The tab headers will scroll to left most automatically, which makes it difficult to right click the tab header to open context menu.

![tab-header](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/16611456/f1cbb744-4393-11e6-9a62-960dcaed9b6f.gif)

It takes me minutes to record above gif as I can't right click the tab header successfully every time.

data.title: Suggestion: Add ability to Find/Replace in selection
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.3.0-insider (a1293f5056e79c3f0e2cd3e24909f41ff4eef472, 2016-07-05T13:09:46.271Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select some text
2. Use Ctrl+F or Ctrl+H
3. Observe that there is no way to find matches and replace all occurrences within the selection.

Side note: would also be nice if there was some way to indicate to "Change All Occurrences (Ctrl+F2)" a range in which to create the cursors.

data.title: Fix extension install when drop into code
data.body: `this.extensionManagementService.install(extPath)` return `void` now.

data.title: Autoformat stops working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

I am not yet quite sure how to reproduce this issue but every now and again - when working for several hours - some of my JS and JSX files no longer format correctly or at all when I hit the shortcut alt+shift+F.

data.title: replace settings variables in debugger config #8042
data.body:
Provide the ability to expose (share) settings from the settings.json file to the launch.json file, using the dollar notation. [#8042](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8042)

settings.json:

``` json
"python.pythonPath": "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.5/bin/python3"
```

launch.json:

``` json
"pythonPath": "${settings.python.pythonPath}",
```
